ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear package

Submodules

ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.base module

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.base.ExoSSLinear(input_dim, output_dim, state_dim, dist_dim, alpha=None)[source]

Bases: SSModel

A continuous-time linear state-space model with exogenous inputs : math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu + Gd \\
y &= Cx

where \(d\) is the exogenous input.

Attributes :

nu (int): number of inputs ny (int): number of outputs nx (int): number of states nd (int): number of exogenous inputs alpha (float, optional) : upper bound on decay rate of matrix A (necessarily Hurwitz)

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int)

  • output_dim (int)

  • state_dim (int)

  • dist_dim (int)

  • alpha (float | None)

clone()[source]

Clone the model, it has to be implemented to be compliant with simulator classes.

eval_()[source]
Return type:

Tuple[Tensor, ...]

forward(u, x, d=None)[source]
Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – input tensor of shape (batch_size, nu)

  • x (Tensor) – state tensor of shape (batch_size, nx)

  • d (Tensor) – exogenous input tensor of shape (batch_size, nd)

Returns:

state derivative tensor of shape (batch_size, nx) y (Tensor): output tensor of shape (batch_size, ny)

Return type:

dx (Tensor)

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, G0, requires_grad=True)[source]

Initialize the weights of the model. :type A0: Tensor :param A0: A matrix of shape (nx, nx) :type A0: Tensor :type B0: Tensor :param B0: B matrix of shape (nx, nu) :type B0: Tensor :type C0: Tensor :param C0: C matrix of shape (ny, nx) :type C0: Tensor :type G0: Tensor :param G0: G matrix of shape (nx, nd) :type G0: Tensor :type requires_grad: :param requires_grad: if True, the parameters will be updated during training :type requires_grad: bool, optional

Parameters:

  • A0 (Tensor)

  • B0 (Tensor)

  • C0 (Tensor)

  • G0 (Tensor)

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.base.SSLinear(input_dim, output_dim, state_dim, alpha=None)[source]

Bases: SSModel

A continuous-time linear state-space model without exogenous inputs and direct trerm : .. math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu \\
y &= Cx
Attributes :

nu (int): number of inputs ny (int): number of outputs nx (int): number of states alpha (float, optional) : upper bound on decay rate of matrix A (necessarily Hurwitz)

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int)

  • output_dim (int)

  • state_dim (int)

  • alpha (float | None)

check_()[source]

Check if the system is stable by checking the eigenvalues of A.

Returns:

True if the system is stable, False otherwise float: maximum eigenvalue of A

Return type:

bool

ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.h2 module

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.h2.ExoH2Linear(nu, ny, nx, nd, gamma_2)[source]

Bases: ExoSSLinear

Create a linear continuous-time state-space model with a prescribed H2 norm and disturbance. math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu + Gd \\
y &= Cx + Du
Parameters:

  • nu (int)

  • ny (int)

  • nx (int)

  • nd (int)

  • gamma_2 (float)

nu

Number of inputs.

Type:

int

ny

Number of outputs.

Type:

int

nx

Number of states.

Type:

int

nd
Type:

int

gamma_2

Prescribed H2 norm.

Type:

float

clone()[source]

Clone the model, it has to be implemented to be compliant with simulator classes.

classmethod copy(model)[source]

This class method returns a copy of a given H2bounded model.

We have to do this trick since self is not usable due to geotorch. Indeed when an object has parameterized attributes its class changes.

Return type:

ExoH2Linear

Parameters:

model (ExoH2Linear)

forward(u, x, d)[source]
Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – input tensor of shape (batch_size, nu)

  • x (Tensor) – state tensor of shape (batch_size, nx)

  • d (Tensor) – exogenous input tensor of shape (batch_size, nd)

Returns:

state derivative tensor of shape (batch_size, nx) y (Tensor): output tensor of shape (batch_size, ny)

Return type:

dx (Tensor)

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, G0, gamma2=None)[source]

Initialize the model with given weights. :type A0: :param A0: Initial state matrix. :type A0: Tensor :type B0: :param B0: Initial input matrix. :type B0: Tensor :type C0: :param C0: Initial output matrix. :type C0: Tensor :type G0: :param G0: Initial disturbance matrix. :type G0: Tensor :param requires_grad: If True, gradients will be computed. :type requires_grad: bool

right_inverse_(A, B, C, G, gamma2, check=False)[source]

Method to initialize Parameter space from given weights

submersion_inv(A, G, C, gamma2=None, epsilon=1e-05, solver='MOSEK', check=False)[source]

Inverse function from Weights space to parameter space.

The LMI to obtain the observability grammian of the system is solved using CVXPY. :type A: :param A: State matrix. :type A: Tensor :type G: :param G: Input disturbance matrix. :type G: Tensor :type C: :param C: Output matrix. :type C: Tensor :type gamma2: :param gamma2: Prescribed H2 norm. :type gamma2: float :type epsilon: :param epsilon: Tolerance for the check. :type epsilon: float :type solver: :param solver: Solver to use for the LMI problem. :type solver: str :type check: :param check: If True, check the feasibility of the problem. :type check: bool

Returns:

Inverse of the observability grammian. S (Tensor): Skew-symetric matrix. Sigma (Tensor): Prescribed trace vector. C (Tensor): Output matrix. U (Tensor): Orthogonal matrix of size nx * nx. Vt (Tensor): Orthogonal matrix of size nd * nd.

Return type:

Wo_inv (Tensor)

Raises:

ValueError – If the LMI problem is infeasible or unbounded.

submersion_inv(A, B, C, gamma2=None, epsilon=1e-07, solver='MOSEK', check=False)[source]

Inverse function from Weights space to parameter space.

The LMI to obtain the observability grammian of the system is solved using CVXPY. :type A: :param A: State matrix. :type A: Tensor :type B: :param B: Input matrix. :type B: Tensor :type C: :param C: Output matrix. :type C: Tensor :type gamma2: :param gamma2: Prescribed H2 norm. :type gamma2: float :type epsilon: :param epsilon: Tolerance for the check. :type epsilon: float :type solver: :param solver: Solver to use for the LMI problem. :type solver: str :type check: :param check: If True, check the feasibility of the problem. :type check: bool

Returns:

Inverse of the observability grammian. S (Tensor): Skew-symetric matrix. M (Tensor): Prescrjbed trace matrix. C (Tensor): Output matrix.

Return type:

Wo_inv (Tensor)

Raises:

ValueError – If the LMI problem is infeasible or unbounded.

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu + B_dd\\
y &= Cx

This method enables to initialize the weights it is both a wrapper for irght_inverse and the not parameterized weights of the module

submersion_inv_lmi(A, B, C, gamma, epsilon=0.0001, solver='MOSEK')[source]

This function computes the parameters Q, P, S, G and H by solving the LMI problem.

Parameters:

  • A (Tensor) – State matrix of shape (nx, nx)

  • B (Tensor) – Input matrix of shape (nx, nu)

  • C (Tensor) – Output matrix of shape (ny, nx)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Returns:

Solution to the LMI problem of shape (nx, nx) P (Tensor): Solution to the LMI problem of shape (nx, nx) S (Tensor): Skew-symmetric matrix of shape (nx, nx) G (Tensor): Matrix of shape (ny, nx) H (Tensor): Matrix of shape (nx, nu) with orthogonal columns gamma_sys (float): Minimum gamma found in the LMI problem

Return type:

Q (Tensor)

submersion_inv_riccati(A, B, C, gamma, epsilon=1e-08)[source]

This function computes the parameters P, G and S by solving the Riccati equation.

Parameters:

  • A (Tensor) – State matrix of shape (nx, nx)

  • B (Tensor) – Input matrix of shape (nx, nu)

  • C (Tensor) – Output matrix of shape (ny, nx)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Returns:

Solution to the Riccati equation of shape (nx, nx) G (Tensor): Matrix of shape (ny, nx) S (Tensor): Skew-symmetric matrix of shape (nx, nx)

Return type:

P (Tensor)

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Q (Tensor)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.implicit module

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.implicit.ImplicitNNLinear(input_dim, output_dim, nx, strSavpath='/home/alexandre/Recherche/librairies/ctrlnmod_git/ctrlnnmod/docs')[source]

Bases: Module

Neural network module corresponding to a (semi) implicit linear state-space model

Ex^+ = Fx + Bu y = Cx with E being invertible. In this case no need to solve an algebraic equation just inverse E to simulate.

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int)

  • output_dim (int)

clone()[source]
forward(u, x)[source]

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, is_grad=True)[source]
class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.implicit.ParamImplicitNNLinear(input_dim, output_dim, nx, strSavpath='/home/alexandre/Recherche/librairies/ctrlnmod_git/ctrlnnmod/docs')[source]

Bases: Module

Neural network module corresponding to a parametrized (semi) implicit discrete time linear state-space model

Ex^+ = Fx + Bu y = Cx with E being invertible. In this case no need to solve an algebraic equation just inverse E to simulate. E is parameterized to satisfy LMI (18) in this paper : https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.05290 (Revay et al. 2020)

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int)

  • output_dim (int)

clone()[source]
forward(u, x)[source]

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

right_inverse(F0, B0, C0, E0, is_grad=True)[source]

For given (F0, B0, C0, E0) we find a right inverse for X and Y :

Parameters:

  • F0 (Tensor)

  • B0 (Tensor)

  • C0 (Tensor)

  • E0 (Tensor)

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.implicit.ParamImplicitNNLinearAlph(input_dim, output_dim, nx, alpha=1.0, strSavpath='/home/alexandre/Recherche/librairies/ctrlnmod_git/ctrlnnmod/docs')[source]

Bases: Module

Neural network module corresponding to a parametrized (semi) implicit discrete time linear state-space model with a prescribed lyapunov exponent alpha in [0,1)

Ex^+ = Fx + Bu y = Cx with E being invertible. In this case no need to solve an algebraic equation just inverse E to simulate. E is parameterized to satisfy LMI (18) in this paper : https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.05290 (Revay et al. 2020)

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int)

  • output_dim (int)

  • alpha (float)

clone()[source]
forward(u, x)[source]

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

right_inverse(A0, B0, C0, is_grad=True)[source]

Module contents

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, G0, gamma2=None)[source]

Initialize the model with given weights. :type A0: :param A0: Initial state matrix. :type A0: Tensor :type B0: :param B0: Initial input matrix. :type B0: Tensor :type C0: :param C0: Initial output matrix. :type C0: Tensor :type G0: :param G0: Initial disturbance matrix. :type G0: Tensor :param requires_grad: If True, gradients will be computed. :type requires_grad: bool

right_inverse_(A, B, C, G, gamma2, check=False)[source]

Method to initialize Parameter space from given weights

submersion_inv(A, G, C, gamma2=None, epsilon=1e-05, solver='MOSEK', check=False)[source]

Inverse function from Weights space to parameter space.

The LMI to obtain the observability grammian of the system is solved using CVXPY. :type A: :param A: State matrix. :type A: Tensor :type G: :param G: Input disturbance matrix. :type G: Tensor :type C: :param C: Output matrix. :type C: Tensor :type gamma2: :param gamma2: Prescribed H2 norm. :type gamma2: float :type epsilon: :param epsilon: Tolerance for the check. :type epsilon: float :type solver: :param solver: Solver to use for the LMI problem. :type solver: str :type check: :param check: If True, check the feasibility of the problem. :type check: bool

Returns:

Inverse of the observability grammian. S (Tensor): Skew-symetric matrix. Sigma (Tensor): Prescribed trace vector. C (Tensor): Output matrix. U (Tensor): Orthogonal matrix of size nx * nx. Vt (Tensor): Orthogonal matrix of size nd * nd.

Return type:

Wo_inv (Tensor)

Raises:

ValueError – If the LMI problem is infeasible or unbounded.

submersion_inv_lmi(A, B, C, gamma, epsilon=0.0001, solver='MOSEK')[source]

This function computes the parameters Q, P, S, G and H by solving the LMI problem.

Parameters:

  • A (Tensor) – State matrix of shape (nx, nx)

  • B (Tensor) – Input matrix of shape (nx, nu)

  • C (Tensor) – Output matrix of shape (ny, nx)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Returns:

Solution to the LMI problem of shape (nx, nx) P (Tensor): Solution to the LMI problem of shape (nx, nx) S (Tensor): Skew-symmetric matrix of shape (nx, nx) G (Tensor): Matrix of shape (ny, nx) H (Tensor): Matrix of shape (nx, nu) with orthogonal columns gamma_sys (float): Minimum gamma found in the LMI problem

Return type:

Q (Tensor)

submersion_inv_riccati(A, B, C, gamma, epsilon=1e-08)[source]

This function computes the parameters P, G and S by solving the Riccati equation.

Parameters:

  • A (Tensor) – State matrix of shape (nx, nx)

  • B (Tensor) – Input matrix of shape (nx, nu)

  • C (Tensor) – Output matrix of shape (ny, nx)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Returns:

Solution to the Riccati equation of shape (nx, nx) G (Tensor): Matrix of shape (ny, nx) S (Tensor): Skew-symmetric matrix of shape (nx, nx)

Return type:

P (Tensor)

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.linear.ExoSSLinear(input_dim, output_dim, state_dim, dist_dim, alpha=None)[source]

Bases: SSModel

A continuous-time linear state-space model with exogenous inputs : math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu + Gd \\
y &= Cx

where \(d\) is the exogenous input.

Attributes :

nu (int): number of inputs ny (int): number of outputs nx (int): number of states nd (int): number of exogenous inputs alpha (float, optional) : upper bound on decay rate of matrix A (necessarily Hurwitz)

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int)

  • output_dim (int)

  • state_dim (int)

  • dist_dim (int)

  • alpha (float | None)

clone()[source]

Clone the model, it has to be implemented to be compliant with simulator classes.

  • d (Tensor) – exogenous input tensor of shape (batch_size, nd)

Returns:

state derivative tensor of shape (batch_size, nx) y (Tensor): output tensor of shape (batch_size, ny)

Check if the model has the correct H2 norm. :type epsilon: :param epsilon: Tolerance for the check. :type epsilon: float

clone()[source]

Clone the model. This method is called by the simulator to create a copy of the model. :returns: A copy of the model :rtype: SSLinear

classmethod copy(model)[source]

This class method returns a copy of a given H2bounded model.

We have to do this trick since self is not usable due to geotorch. Indeed when an object has parameterized attributes its class changes.

Return type:

H2Linear

Parameters:

model (H2Linear)

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, requires_grad=True)[source]

Initialize the model with given weights. :type A0: :param A0: Initial state matrix. :type A0: Tensor :type B0: :param B0: Initial input matrix. :type B0: Tensor :type C0: :param C0: Initial output matrix. :type C0: Tensor :type requires_grad: :param requires_grad: If True, gradients will be computed. :type requires_grad: bool

right_inverse_(A, B, C, gamma2, check=False)[source]

Method to initialize Parameter space from given weights

submersion_inv(A, B, C, gamma2=None, epsilon=1e-07, solver='MOSEK', check=False)[source]

Inverse function from Weights space to parameter space.

The LMI to obtain the observability grammian of the system is solved using CVXPY. :type A: :param A: State matrix. :type A: Tensor :type B: :param B: Input matrix. :type B: Tensor :type C: :param C: Output matrix. :type C: Tensor :type gamma2: :param gamma2: Prescribed H2 norm. :type gamma2: float :type epsilon: :param epsilon: Tolerance for the check. :type epsilon: float :type solver: :param solver: Solver to use for the LMI problem. :type solver: str :type check: :param check: If True, check the feasibility of the problem. :type check: bool

Returns:

Inverse of the observability grammian. S (Tensor): Skew-symetric matrix. M (Tensor): Prescrjbed trace matrix. C (Tensor): Output matrix.

Return type:

Wo_inv (Tensor)

Raises:

ValueError – If the LMI problem is infeasible or unbounded.
